thread.title: Camila Cabello shows off taut tummy in two-piece dress | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Camila Cabello shows off taut tummy in two-piece dress | Daily Mail Online

author: Justin Enriquez
title: Camila Cabello shows off taut tummy in two-piece dress | Daily Mail Online
text: Share The most stylish of all was definitely a blue patterned two-piece off-the-shoulder mini dress. She teamed the stylish number with a pair of bright red leather shoes for a classic twist. Looking good: The 19-year-old singer definitely looked in fine form as she showed off her taut tummy in two different midriff-baring outfits Wow factor: The most stylish of all was definitely a blue patterned two-piece off-the-shoulder mini dress Chill mode: She took a breather before filming her next scene Good vibes: The former Fifth Harmony member seemed to have a good time at the event Her brunette tresses were worn down into waves flowing over her shoulders as she let her natural looks show with complimentary make-up topped off with a swipe of shiny pink lip. She also wore a ruched white top with matching high-waisted jeans but kept up with the theme by wearing strappy red heels. Camila was joined on the shoot by Colombian singer J Balvin as they hung out in front of classic and muscle cars. Wonder in white: She later switched into a ruched white top with matching high-waisted jeans but kept up with the theme by wearing strappy red heels Moving and grooving: She showed off her dance moves Keeping cool: She wore her brunette tresses in a ponytail It still has yet to be revealed what the shoot was for but Pitbull is also said to be involved in the project though he was not photographed on set. This comes just after the starlet revealed in a new interview with Billboard that she has yet to speak with her former Fifth Harmony band mates since leaving the group, after five years together. The singer whose Billboard cover was shot on an iPhone 7 Plus using the new Portrait mode, said attempts at breaking the ice with the girls were 'intense' and left her feeling 'sad.' 'I don't want to get into the details of that,' Camila told the magazine after asked if she had attempted to contact the girls herself. 'Because it was really intense and it's hard for me to talk about. It makes me sad.' Dynamic duo: She starred on the music video with Colombian singer J Balvin Chemistry: The two had an obvious connection during the shoot Up close and personal: Camila even draped her arm on the singer's shoulder Chatting it up: In between takes the two singers talked Showing his style: J Balvin sported a Hawaiian patterned shirt over a white top with beige cargo trousers When Camila announced that she was leaving the group, the remaining members- Ally Brooke, Dinah Jane, Lauren Jauregui and Normani Kordei- took to social media last December to say how shocked they were that their fifth member was leaving them, that Camila's manager had told the group about her exit, but were remaining positive about the future. 'We were truly hurt. We've been together for almost five years, been through ups and downs,' a statement from the girls said. 'While this isn't the way any one of us would have wanted this chapter in our lives to have ended, we had to begin to formulate a plan and constructive path for Fifth Harmony to move forward, beyond Camila.' 'It was really intense': Camila talked about her painful split from Fifth Harmony for the latest issue of Billboard Leap of faith: Cabello was a member of Fifth Harmony since 2012 Heaven on earth: The popstrel lounged on the floor in her angelic white dress Camila admitted to the music magazine that she had originally imagined a more amicable exit from the group, and that she was surprised by the way things turned out. 'I hoped that it would be a peaceful turning of the page and we would root for each other. But I only got love for them,' she said. Born in Cuba, Camila moved to the United States as a young girl and eventually was discovered on the X-Factor alongside her then future-girl group, Fifth Harmony, in 2012. Her time to shine: The singer has previously released singles on her own, which have enjoyed places on the charts All that glitters: The star showed off her svelte physique in a sequin dress Not easy: Camila admitted to the music magazine that she had originally imagined a more amicable exit from the group, and that she was surprised by the way things turned out The group are behind hits Boss, Sledgehammer, Worth It, and more recently, Work From Home. Outside of the group, Camila has released I Know What You Did Last Summer and Bad Things, both of which enjoyed places on the charts. Camila says she was aware of the risks she took when she decided to leave the group. Stardom bound: Cabello rocked a beautiful star print dress 'It's definitely not the safe option': Camila, pictured at the Grammy Awards in Los Angeles, views the risky decision to leave the group as a chance to grow Not exactly on speaking terms: The ladies of Fifth Harmony appeared without Cabello in February in West Hollywood 'The easiest route would be to shut my mouth, sing the songs, wear the clothes and keep going, you know?' she told Billboard. 'I mean, [we were] at the peak of our career. It's definitely not the safe option. 'I have it in my DNA. The way my mom raised me, it has always been: Don't settle. Jump and hope you grow wings on the way down.' Break from the group: Camila with former Fifth Harmony band mates, Ally Brooke, Normani Kordei, Dinah-Jane, and Lauren Jauregui in Las Vegas in May 2016 'The peak of our career': Camilla performed alongside her former band mates at the Billboard Music Awards in 2016 She said she believed her desire to 'honor that inner voice' - which she said she encouraged her band members to do as well - may have led to the downfall. 'I think that in a group there is always going to be tension, whether it's because of this thing or [another] thing. Obviously, I think that rocked the boat,' she said. Camila previously explained leaving the band was a chance for her to stay true to her artistic vision. 'Fifth Harmony wasn't the maximum expression of me individually,' she recently told Seventeen . 'My fans are really going to know me from the music I'm writing. My goal is to be brave and open up my soul.' Camila's upcoming solo album is due out in fall, according to Billboard. Moving on: The remainder of Fifth Harmony posed together at the People's Choice Awards Read more:
